text.p: Finnish plastic and cleaning equipment maker Lassila & Tikanoja Oy said in its eight-month interim statement on Friday it expected its full-year profit to be better than in 1995.
"The group profit in 1996 is expected to be good and to be better than in 1995," it said.
In 1995, Lassila posted a 109 million markka profit before extraordinary items.
It now expected a good trend in all units at the year-end.
Amerplast's order backlog was good and its good trend was expected to continue.
Inka's end-year would be at least on par with the performance so far. The unit's result would be weaker than last year but remain satisfactory.
JWS had performed slightly below expectations, but was now expected to improve.

Sakkivaline's favourable trend would continue, but there was reason to bear in mind that due to the character of its operations, the second tertial tended to be better than the other tertials, Lassila & Tikanoja said.
